question: At 500 K, for a reversible reaction <katex>$A_{2(g)}+B_{2(g)}\rightleftharpoons2AB_{(g)}$</katex> in a closed container, <katex>$K_{C}=2\times10^{-5}$</katex>. In the presence of catalyst, the equilibrium is attaining 10 times faster. The equilibrium constant <katex>$K_{C}$</katex> in the presence of catalyst at the same temperature is
explanation: A catalyst increases the rate of both forward and backward reactions equally.
It helps attain equilibrium faster but **does not alter the value of the equilibrium constant (<katex>$K_C$</katex>)**.
